title: Thunderbird NOT working anylonger under Windows 11 with Gmail?!
creator: info2511
content: Since we needed to upgrade 2 PCs to Windows 11 (1x Pro & 1x Home) nothing works anymore with Thunderbird. It has MASSIVE and unsolvable problems to connect to our Gmail account via OAuth, Not only will it ask every single time again and over again to allow the connection, but moreover even after granting access it still can NOT send (SMTP) or save or even receive (IMAP) emails. It is maga frustrating and I am currently after days and days spend to unsuccessful fix the problem are at the point to looks for a more reliable alternative (if there is any). Just as background: Our Gmail account is about 14GB big, the local Thunderbird folder around 100GB; so yes it's big, but that's another problem, there are no easy or straightforward off-line archivers any longer to effectively and still easy accessible reduce the local archive.

title: Updating Profiles between two desktops running Thunderbird
creator: mayserin
content:
I have Thunderbird installed on a Surface Pro running Windows10 and on a Surface Pro running Linux Fedora. When I use the Windows10 computer to prepare a Thunderbird export file for the profile, the Fedora machine Thuderbird import command will not read it.

The Windows10 machine has Thunderbird 147 and the Fedora machine has 146. Is the difference in version responsible for the failure to import the profile files? Or is it something else?

If the difference is the version of Thunderbird, then how do I get 147 on my Fedora machine?

If it is something else, what do I do so that I do not lose saved emails and calendar data from 147 version when I am running the 146 version?

title: Opening template acts different in different accounts
creator: kharrisma
content:
Hi All,

I have three different email accounts. In my main gmail account, if I double-click on a template, it opens up in a new email with the content of the template already in there (which is how I want it to behave.) In my other two accounts, double-clicking a template just opens a new tab with the contents of the template displayed, as it would if I double-clicked any email in my inbox.

I've been through the settings, comparing them for all three accounts, and I can find no difference anywhere. Right-clicking on the Template folder offers no obvious path to follow, nor does right-clicking on the template itself.

Any ideas why the difference in behavior, and/or suggestions on how to change the not-gmail account so it behaves the same way as the gmail account (double-click opens new pre-filled email) ??

Thanks!!!

title: Very Slow Thunderbird. Works for about 3 emails then seizes up completely.
creator: martin.anderson
content: Actually this is more an observation than a query, but I hope it's helpful. My Thunderbird V147.0 running two accounts on IMAP, Windows 11 and a lot of local folders (35Gb) had slowly got slower, but then just about packed up. e.g. 5 minutes to load one email, 20 minutes to download maybe 25 emails. Then it would stop completely requiring a Task Manager terminate and a restart. I read all the advice and tried a lot of it, but didn't see anything about the "global-messages-db.sqlite" file affecting performance. Anyway I got to having a look at it - 1.37Gb!! Deleted the "global-messages-db.sqlite" file and restarted. Thunderbird was back to normal and now 10 days later the sqlite file seems to be stable at approx 41Mb. I have no idea how it grew so big (33 times bigger than it seems it needs to be), I have never deleted it before and I have probably been using the current Thunderbird configuration for 20 years, but I imagined that reindexing etc would keep it a manageable size, clearly not. I wonder whether there should be a "Clear down Global Messages DB" button.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Windows 11

title: Preview of threaded message pane background color is different from individual message pane background color
creator: PercussionGuy33
content: When using Thunderbird 140 I am able to setup the background color of the message pane for individual messages. However when the messages are threaded, the message pane shows a preview of all of the threaded messages together in the message pane with a different background color than individual messages.

title: Thunderbird loading twice
creator: aussieq
content: my problem started when I got greedy and highlighted too much mail in gmail for deletion. There was warning but I wasn't worried about the time but that was 2 days ago Now when I open thunderbird it comes up twice but 1 not responding in task manager. I have deleted the programme twice but when the new install tries to open it's the same thing. I have 7 or so accounts and thunderbird works fine for me. I bought a copy of office from microsoft but the outlook didn't open the pst file(not happy) but I am happier with thunderbird. as I used it many years ago Any help suggestions would be greatly appreciated. I am in Aus btw

title: Why does oauth2 not allow me to log in with a personal account like hotmail/outlook when setting up email accounts in Thunderbird?
creator: Darkeforce
content:
I'm trying to add my email accounts to Thunderbird, I manage to get everything set up okay (using "outlook.office365.com" as the SMTP server rather than the auto-selected "mail-smtp@outlook.com" that is autofilled), but when I try to add it and the popup window for Oauth2 opens up, I enter my email and password for my hotmail and outlook accounts, I get an error saying:

You can't sign in here with a personal account. Use your work or school account instead.

What's going on? I never had trouble setting up Oauth2 with my personal accounts before, until I switched to a Windows 11 computer (was using Windows 10 before).

What am I doing wrong? Or is this some kind of messup with Microsoft. I set up my Gmail account (with Oauth2) without any trouble?

I can't find any solutions to this online. Please help. I'm desperate to get access to my email on my new computer.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Windows 11 Pro 64bit

title: I would pay for this: (better email filtering)
creator: yukitaga
content:
There are certain emails that I receive that are *absolutely known* spam. I want these (but ONLY these) deleted as they come in.

I understand that one need to tick the "delete" box in Settings, but this seems to giver Thunderbird the right to delete anything that 𝒊𝒕 determines is spam. I don't want that. I want ONLY my own predetermined spam to be deleted.

And by deleted, I mean just that. Thunderbird just piles them up in the Trash folder, and this gets to be a big pile. Because Thunderbird makes mistakes, cannot just let it delete everything it determines to be spam, and so I have to go through this long list of junk in the Trash folder, which is annoying (because there's surely a better way that no one has implemented yet) and time-consuming.

I've made my own "delete" filter. It runs first (it's the first filter in the list), "before Junk Classification" and "Getting New Mail". Anything on this list should be deleted, because that's the ONLY action I have in this filter. If you're in here, you're gone.

Except your not. The filter is (for some reason) NOT run when new mail arrives. Instead, I have to open the filter, and choose "run on Trash folder". Then it works. But is THAT the design?!? Why is it not deleting arriving mail that meets the criteria?

There is also the problem now (as spammers have gotten more proficient) of the random character string preceding the @, followed by a domain name that you dare not mark as spam (for example, yahoo.com). These random characters are indeed random, and constantly changing, so you cannot filter on the address. But it seems to me some bright person might come up with something like "if 'known domain' is NOT preceded by 'known sender', delete". (This would require a user [me] to be very careful, or I could lose a new respondent who is not spamming me.)

But the point here is this: Over time, I have a great "delete" filter. Mail that this filter catches makes NO mistake. I want these messages (but ONLY these messages) to be gone when mail is retrieved. I don't want them in the Trash. And I don't want to have to take the time to run that filter on the Trash, because no one has created an extension that allows me to do this with a single click.

I would pay/donate, for this capability. But I can't bring myself to donate, or pay, when I have to go through a big Trash pile full of mail that, according to my filter, I should NEVER even see.

Other suggestions entertained of course.

But I'm spending too much of my life dealing with things that should be automated.

Regards,

title: How does one export one's private key (secret key) using OpenPGP in Thunderbird in Windows 10
creator: antifascist
content:
How does one export one's private key (secret key) using OpenPGP in Thunderbird in Windows 10?

In this directory... C:\Users\meow\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\yy677g4j.default-release\

I find these files... (I have obfuscated some of the file names) secring.gpg pubring.gpg 0xBBBBBBBBBBBBBB_rev.asc 0xAAAAAAAAAAAAAA_rev.asc 0xCCCCCCCCCCCCC_rev.asc

It seems that the secring.gpg file would contain 3 private keys, corresponding to the 3 public keys shown. I would like to ask how can I create a file containing the private key which corresponds to the "CCCCC..." public key but NOT containing the private key for any other key pair.

Thunderbird's OpenPGP menu allows me to easily export the public key, but does not seem to provide any mechanism for exporting my private key.

Thanks for your advice! ~uxfail

title: Shift F5
creator: itm8b
content:
In einer frischen Thunderbird-Installation (getestet mit 140 ESR und 147) funktioniert der manuelle globale Abruf per Shift + F5 nicht mehr für POP3-Konten.

Konkret: – POP3-Konten sind korrekt eingerichtet – „Beim Starten auf neue Nachrichten prüfen“ aktiv – „Alle X Minuten auf neue Nachrichten prüfen“ aktiv (z. B. 2880 Minuten) – Thunderbird ist online

Erwartetes Verhalten: Shift + F5 bzw. „Alle Konten abrufen“ prüft die POP3-Konten und holt neue Nachrichten ab (wie in früheren Versionen).

Tatsächliches Verhalten: – Shift + F5 bewirkt gar nichts – Kein Abruf, keine Fehlermeldung, keine Statusanzeige – Gleiches Verhalten bei „Alle Konten abrufen“

Wichtig: Der Abruf funktioniert sofort, wenn man per Rechtsklick gezielt ein einzelnes POP3-Konto → „Nachrichten abrufen“ auswählt.

Das zeigt, dass – Server erreichbar sind – Konten korrekt konfiguriert sind – das Problem ausschließlich den globalen manuellen Abruf betrifft

Zusätzlich scheint Shift + F5 inzwischen nur noch Konten zu berücksichtigen, die für den automatischen Abruf vorgesehen sind, wobei dies selbst bei gesetzten Haken nicht zuverlässig funktioniert. Dieses Verhalten ist weder dokumentiert noch für den Benutzer nachvollziehbar.

Fazit: Der bisher etablierte Workflow „manuell alle POP3-Konten abrufen“ ist in aktuellen Thunderbird-Versionen faktisch nicht mehr nutzbar. Für langjährige POP3-Nutzer ist das eine massive Verschlechterung der Bedienbarkeit.

Ist dieses Verhalten beabsichtigt (Designentscheidung) oder handelt es sich um eine Regression? Falls beabsichtigt: Warum gibt es keinen Ersatz für den früheren selektiven/globalen Abruf?
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/144.0.0.0 Safari/537.36;os:WIN 10 vor dem Umstieg auf WIN 11;kb_visits_prior:["/de/kb/unaufgeforderte-verbindungen-thunderbird"];solver_id:7364294

title: Frozen when receiving emails
creator: cpaveglio
content: When I am working from home, on my home network, and using a VPN, (Windows 11) whenever I receive new messages, the app becomes completely frozen. That is, if the app is in the background and I receive an email "bing bong" notification, I can go to the app, but I can not click on anything. Nothing responds. I cannot change tabs, select a message, move the window, or even use the close box to quit the application. I must force quit via the Windows tray icon. If I open the application and it immediately checks for messages and gets new messages, also I can not interact with any on-screen window or element. I must force quit. Then, after force quitting, I reopen again, and get no new messages, the previously new messages I can click on and read. So at no time can I get messages, and continue using the app. I also had a draft email in progress, and received new messages, and then the draft message was non interactive. When I tried to quit the app, I saw a popup message about saving the draft, but also could not click on it. This problem does not happen at work on my internal network and no VPN. Our email is all POP based (yes you read that right, all POP no IMAP), FWIW.

title: Antagonist mail account mail.s23k.com doesn't work
creator: jean.paul.sablerolle
content:
I am experiencing persistent issues configuring a custom-domain email account in Mozilla Thunderbird, while the same account works correctly in Outlook and in webmail.

Environment:

Email client: Mozilla Thunderbird (latest version)

OS: Windows

Mail hosting: Antagonist / DirectAdmin (shared hosting)

Domain: s23k.com

Email address: jean-paul.sablerolle@s23k.com

Incoming mail (POP):

Server: mail.s23k.com

Port: 995

Security: SSL/TLS

Authentication: normal password POP connection works without errors.

Outgoing mail (SMTP):

Server: mail.s23k.com

Ports tested: 465 (SSL/TLS), 587 (STARTTLS)

Thunderbird fails to send mail with the error:

“The requested domain name does not match the server’s certificate.”

Even after explicitly adding and permanently accepting the certificate exception, Thunderbird continues to reject the connection.

Important observations:

Webmail (Roundcube) can send mail successfully.

Microsoft Outlook can send mail successfully using the same SMTP server.

Thunderbird never completes SMTP authentication because the TLS handshake fails on hostname validation.

The certificate presented by the server appears to be issued for a different hostname than mail.s23k.com.

As a workaround, I am currently using an external SMTP server (KPN: smtp.kpnmail.nl), which works correctly in Thunderbird.

Question: Is Thunderbird intentionally stricter than Outlook regarding TLS hostname validation for SMTP, and is there any supported way to:

properly override this hostname mismatch for SMTP, or

diagnose whether this behavior is expected and unavoidable with misconfigured server certificates?

I would like to confirm whether this is expected Thunderbird behavior or if there is a configuration option I may have missed.

I am not trying to weaken security; I want to understand whether Thunderbird allows any safe override in this scenario or if the server configuration is fundamentally incompatible.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Windows

content: Tengo una cuenta de outlook de microsoft acabada hotmail.com y quise hacer una copia de seguridad de los correos de hotmail, pero como la cuenta no es una cuenta microsoft 365 no pude, y intente exportar los correos a thunberbird y hicé una copia de los correos de outlook con thunberbird. El problema es que ahora en la cuenta de outlook me faltan correos que ahora están en la cuenta de thunberbird y no sé como restaurar esos correos con la copia de seguridad de thunberbird a outlook para que quede como estaba la cuenta de hotmail.com. No sé si alguien conoce como hacerlo. Tampoco sé como visualizar los correos de la copia de seguridad de thunberbird, no sé si exite algún programa para visualizarlos. Pienso que en la copia de seguridad ha creado un archivo tipo MSF. Gracias y espero la respuesta de alguien que pueda ayudarme, pues estos correos son importantes para mi.

title: Thunderbird 145 & 147 - frequent errors connecting to server "outlook..."
creator: Cronk
content:
This just started 4 or 5 days ago ( 2026.1.23 ish). I did not update TB nor make any changes to the account in question (that I'm aware of). The errors show up every few minutes, with a 'beep' sound and notification pop-up showing up each time - is very annoying.

I was running v145 when it started. I saw there was an update to 147 and installed that; same issue. I restarted TB into Troubleshooting mode and am still getting the error.

This is running on MacOS 15.7.3. Hardware is MacMini (2024) with Apple M4 chip.

Generally I still seem able to received & send emails.

I opened Activity Manager and Error Console. Error console doesn't seem to have much (using 'Multiprocess', with Errors, Warnings, Logs, Debug enabled). Activity manager shows things such as:

<my account name> 

   Connection to server outlook.office365.com was interrupted.    09:49    Failed to connect to server outlook.office365.com.    09:52    Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com.    09:58    Authentication failure while connecting to server outlook.office365.com.    10:03    Connection to server outlook.office365.com was interrupted.    10:10    Connection to server outlook.office365.com was interrupted.    10:14    Connection to server outlook.office365.com was interrupted.    10:20

There was an error or log entry that I was able to find a few days ago that made me think it was Calendar related, but now I'm not finding that message.

title: can connect to imap and discover folders, but inbox not updated (downloaded) since 5 days
creator: kbuecher1
content:
TB 128 stopped downloading messages from 1blu.de on one 1blu account, another is working.

Switching to pop did not help, neither resetting password on server. Going back to imap did not help. Update to 140.7.1 did not help. In 140, TB connects, searching folders, discovers inbox, but no download of new messages. Inbox is abonniert (subscribed?) and messages are set to loaded to TB.

inbox.msf is updated today, the inbox has a date of Jan 26, latest downloaded email as of Jan. 21, inbox is 3GB and writeable.

In itself, the account at 1blu is ok: the release version (146.0.1) can connect and download messages dated until tonight (=right now).

1blu recommended to delete/reinstall the account but that would mean loosing tags and maybe xnotes.


Any help is appreciated. I write legacy and webextention addons for TB and can run test code in the console or in a temporary addon, if needed/helpful.

Thanks, Klaus/opto

title: E-Mail registration on Thunderbird fail
creator: kathrin.liewert
content: Hello there, I have troubles signing into my email account on Thunderbird. I have a new laptop, therefore installed the program again, as I used it on my old laptop too. When I wanna sign up my email though, it gives me an error message that reads "Anmeldung auf dem Server fehlgeschlagen. Eventuell sind Konfiguration, Benutzername oder Passwort nicht korrekt". I'm writing in English here, since the Support site won't allow me to use the German site for whatever reason. Finding this contact form was also hard. Anyways, the German text translates roughly into "sign in didn't work, probably configuration, user name or password are incorrect". My password is correct, my e-mail is correct, I double and triple checked. It wants a full name from me. My mail account is from t-online and doesn't have a user name. So I entered my full name. Didn't work. I entered my t-online user ID, didn't work. I used only my first name. Didn't work. I tried out both IMAP and POP3 configurations, both lead to the same error message. According to my t-online account, IMAP is supported. One more thing: Before selecting IMAP or POP3, I received the message that my data was in fact found in the Mozilla ISP data base. Please help. Thanks!

title: Thunderbird .. dopo alcuni problemi dei giorni scorsi mi ritrovo più dettagli nelle mail che ricevo tipo "ID messaggio" e "Return-path"
creator: alinghy
content:
Buon pomeriggio Staff,

dopo alcuni problemi risolti positivamentesu Thunderbird anche grazie all'aiuto prezioso di NEXT, forse nel caos in cui mi sono trovato nel fare varie prove per temtare di risolvere il predetto problema, devo aver inavvertitamente attivato qualche opzione contenuta in Thunderbird per cui ora, per ogni mail che ricevo, mi ritrovo nella cornice superiore dell'anteprima dove appare il mittente il destinatario e l'oggetto della mail ora sotto compaiono anche "ID messaggio" e Return-path", ma la cosa più invasiva, a mio vedere, è che se faccio inolta per un messaggio la finestra che si apre è colma nella parte superiore e a scendere verso il basso dei dettagli che individuano la mail, i sever tramite la quale è stata spedita e davvero una marea di dettagli tecnici per cui allego una immagine che rende bene l'idea nel merito così come per il primo problema descritto. Spero qualcuno riesca a darmi un suggerimento per disattivare tutta questa mole di dettagli che è inutile facendo un "inoltro" di uan mail, mentre è certo utile per dettagliare la provenienza di una mail per altri motivi.

Grazie anticipatamente Fabio
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:147.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/147.0;os:Win 11 pro

title: Migrating from [very] old Thunderbird to current version
creator: zyzoff
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for many years. My current version is 45.2.0. My computer runs Linux Kubuntu 15.10

So yes, it's ten years old and it's showing its age. I have a new box I built, and have Kubuntu 25.04 installed. It installed the then current version of TB. I have yet to set things up, but migrating is a priority now.

Some solutions say (on ubuntu/kubuntu) to just copy the directory "/home/username/.thunderbird/profile.default" from the old to the new box. I would likely do it by zip, rar or ssh transfer.

If I do that, when opening up TB on the new box, does the data get converted? and if so, is it automatic? It seems to me that after then years, the data format would have some changes.

I'd appreciate any insight on this. Thank you.

title: Deleting IMAP folders.
creator: mozilla788

title: The E-mail which I received on January 29, 2026
creator: ssh6820
content:
My name is Yoshinobu OKUMOTO. I live in Nara prefecture in Japan. I use Thunderbird as my e-mail software. My e-mail address is "<edited>@asahi.email.ne.jp". I have received a mail at January 29 18:35, 2026 . In the space for name of a sender of the mail, "<edited>@asahi.email.ne.jp" is written. This is my e-mail address in Thunderbird. I did not sent a mail at January 29 18:35, 2026 . I wonder who sent this mail to me.

When this mail was sent to me, a red spam mail mark was attached to this mail. Usually, when I received a spam mail, I transfer the spam mail to a spam mail folder. But in this case, if I transfer this mail to a spam mail folder, I worries that transformation might transfer a mail from my acquaintance to the spam mail folder from that time on.

In the main body of the mail which I received at January 29 18:35, 2026, it was written as follows.

" Account is invalid. 

When this page is displayed, the total of the account "asahi.email.ne.jp" is invalid.

The procedure to confirm the reason 1. Log-in with a browser, for example Chrome, to the account "asahi.email.ne.jp." 2.If the account is invalid, the explanation is displayed."

In the sentences mentioned above, " Account is invalid. When this page is displayed, the total of the account "asahi.email.ne.jp" is invalid." But I can use my Thunderbird as usual except this mail.

Next, I tried to log-in to the account "asahi.email.ne.jp" with a browser Chrome, I could not log-in.

I already received this mail which have the same text three times until now, 1/20 19:17, 1/21 17:21, 1/24 21:04.

If it is necessary for me to forward to you the mail which I received at January 29 18:35, 2026, I send the mail if you inform me of your mail address.

I will be thankful, if you give me some advices in this case.

(Mr) Yoshinobu OKUMOTO

title: ISP Blames Mozilla - No Email for 5 days Now!
creator: redacted
content:
Hello,

Need To Know:

I have used Thunderbird (TBird) for many years. Recently, I moved TBird data from a Dell Inspiron 530 Win 7, to Alien Arora 1250. Unfortunately, the passwords would not go, so I copy and pasted the data for 10 email addresses. All worked well, until 5 days ago when I could not log into the ISP.

Since then, 12 ISP tech support people gave me 12 different was to fix the login problem. The 'logging in' kept trying to login. The only way to stop it is to close TB and restart it. The same happens with all 10 accounts - can't login.

I followed instructions to the letter and nothing worked. Later, a tech at ISP said they have had a lot of complaints from people with Tbird and said it's Mozilla's fault. They all said they don't support Thunderbird. They only support webmail. One even suggested I delete all my cookies. Of course I'm not going to do that.

You would not believe the amount of crazy ideas I was given.

Here is the core problem:

I used both Pop and IMAP depending on the email account. TBird was great with POP and IMAP either.

I changed all the passwords as instructed. I followed the Step-x-Step settings on the ISP web site

The ISP, Rogers, took over Shaw. Rogers, I'm told, dropped support for 3rd party email clients and requires customers to create a new email on their Webmail host. Webmail is WEBmail because it is not Email.

Testing Out TBird:

  1. On the old Win 7 TBird (Ver. 68.1.1 (32-bit)) Email works with both POP and IMAP settings.
  2. On the new Rig, Tbird (V. 147.0 (64-bit)) worked for a while.

What Happens: -- Due to the issues, I set Tbird to not:, -- Check for new messages at startup -- Check for new messages every -- Automatically download new messages -- Fetch headers only

The two ISP are Rogers Rogers and Shaw <--- just redirects to Rogers. But webmail.shaw.ca still works.

My Rig with the issues: Alienware Aurora Desktop 1250 Intel i9 Ultra Nvidia RTS 5080 Memory 32 GB DDR5 Storage 2 TB SSD + 2Tb HDD Thunderbird Version-147.0 (64-bit)

Is the ISP correct, that Thunderbird may be the core problem?

Thanks for your volunteering - where would we be without you, ~r

TBird 140.7.0esr, Thunderbird for Linux Mint. Mint version 22.3.

title: When using backspace during editing, cursor position jumps to wrong spot
creator: Cronk
content:
This has been happening for a long long time - probably a few years' worth of versions. I have just put up with it... currently running Tbird 147 and it just happened.

When editing an email (either the body or the Subject), if you use the backspace button (the one that deletes to the left) to delete some text sometimes the cursor will incorrectly be positioned about 5 or 6 characters further left than it should.

For example, if I had the text: "Quick brown fox jumps over the moon"

If I were to highlight "fox" in the above example, and hit backspace, I would expect the cursor to end up positioned between the remaining spaces after 'brown' ( pipe symbol here is meant to represent the cursor position): "brown | jumps"

But instead what happens is that the cursor ends up somewhere among/before the word "brown". It's always further left than it should be, by 5 or 6 characters.

I believe it only happens when highlighting multiple characters and then hitting backspace. It may be more (only?) prevalent when editing/replying to an existing email. (But I'm still only editing the new portions that I add at the top of the email; I'm almost never editing in amongst the original quoted email content.)

I also haven't ever been able to figure out how to make it happen, sorry. It is just random...It will happen once in an email, but then not again. But it happens frequently - 3-6 times a day perhaps. (Depends on how many emails I am editing.  :) )

I don't believe that I have noticed this issue if I were using the Delete button (deletes things to the right). I don't think it happens when backspacing one character at a time...but it might. I also use Option-Backspace to delete whole words at a time (instead of highlighting the word); not exactly sure if it happens only if highlighting a word, or only if Option-Backspace, or single key press... sorry, it is so random and unexpected that I don't have more specifics.

title: Email clients using emails to create training databases for AI
creator: marilynbennett04
content:
It recently came to my attention that Gmail is using my (and others) emails to train their AI to provide "overviews" for email threads. I didn't find that in any of the recent Agreement changes so feel safe is stating Alphabet/Google never obtained my permission for this training. I'm not a fan of the far-flung use of AI and the mounting examples of how horrendously Google AI performs hasn't done anything to relieve my concerns.

I began a search for a better, reliable email client and there is a depressing shortage of them that fulfill the average email users' needs. Thunderbird looks pretty good but reading through the Help section, Community Forum questions and just general articles hasn't clarified a couple of questions I have.

1. Is Thunderbird a comprehensive email client, independent of other clients, or does it provide service by partnering with another client?

2. Does Thunderbird utilize AI for any purpose that requires the "review" and storage of individual users' emails?

Many thanks, MarilynB

2019 MacBook Pro

title: change the color of a message using userChrome
creator: GlenR
content:
I’m running Thunderbird 147.0.1 (64-bit) on both my desktop and laptop, both using Windows 11 Version 25H2 (Build 26200.7705). I’m trying to highlight sent (outgoing) messages where the correspondent and recipient are different (i.e., not sending to myself). When this condition is met, I want the subject line to appear green. My logic is: • Match outgoing mail where the correspondent column contains one of my addresses • Exclude rows where the recipient column also contains one of my addresses • Apply formatting only to the subject column tr:has( 

   td.correspondentcol-column[title*="@pm.me"],    td.correspondentcol-column[title*="@protonmail.com"],    td.correspondentcol-column[title*="@passinbox.com"]

):not( 

   :has(td.recipientcol-column[title*="@pm.me"]),    :has(td.recipientcol-column[title*="@protonmail.com"]),    :has(td.recipientcol-column[title*="@passinbox.com"])

) td.subjectcol-column { 

 color: var(--tb-green) !important;  font-weight: 600 !important;  background-color: #e8f5e9 !important;

} Same Thunderbird version, same Windows build, same CSS file, same mail account structure. Is there something on the desktop system that could prevent this from working? For example: • about:config setting related to CSS • Layout or column differences affecting selectors • Rendering engine differences between installations • UI density / table layout mode differences My expectation is that this logic should behave identically on both systems, so I suspect a configuration or UI state difference. Any guidance would be appreciated.

title: Emails going into wrong local folders
creator: guavaman
content:
A while back I noticed that an email that would normally have appeared in my Inbox was not in one of the local folders I created. I have a number of message filters that send emails into local folders, but I had not created one for the domain this email came from. Since then, this has happened with a number of emails, in some cases emails from new senders. Also, I'm pretty sure that a few emails that should have gone into one specific folder based on a message filter I created ended up in another.

Any idea why this is happening and how I can fix it?

title: Thunderbird no longer sends successfully from att.net (yahoo) account
creator: jallan32
content:
I recently had to change my password for my att.net email account. My iPhone and the att web mail have successfully read up to 0936, while thunderbird has only read up to 0922, and I cannot get the new password entered successfully to read any further.

Meanwhile, the sending function also cannot get the new password entered successfully.

This is the same password that now works on web mail and on my iPhone.

Account settings, server settings show the IMAP mail server is "imap.mail.att.net" port 993, username = email address in att.net domain, security is SSL/TLS normal password, Outgoing server default is "smtp.mail.att.net" port 465, same username, SSL/TLS normal password.

Settings, privacy and security, saved passwords locked up the mouse with giant cursor showing, had to close thunderbird via Alt+F4, mouse still locked up with giant cursor, had to close all other windows with Alt+F4, hoping to be able to close this one before rebooting computer.

title: Problème "Local Folder"
creator: thierry.teillet
content: Bonjour, J'ai Thunderbird depuis très longtemps et j'ai toujours pris l'habitude de stocker tous mes mails dans le répertoire "Dossiers locaux" qui se trouvait toujours sur un HDD différent de celui ou était installé Thunderbird. A chaque nouvelle installation de Thunderbird, je renseignais le chemin ou était stocké "Dossiers Locaux" et hop en 30s, j'avais tous mes messages archivés depuis des années. Je viens de changer de version de Ubuntu (24.04.3 LTS) et la nouveau Thunderbird (140.7.1 esr), donc comme d'habitude je renseigne le chemin de mon répertoire local "Dossiers Locaux" mais rien ne remonte dans Thunderbird ? J'ai essayé (bidouillé) plein de petits trucs sans succès et je ne m'en sort pas ! Pouvez-vous svp me renseigner ?
